original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rigs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la rab tu brtson pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rigs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la rab tu brtson pa yin /
translated: They are dedicated to perfecting all types of bodhisattva conduct.

original: smon lam gyi rigs thams cad rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: smon lam gyi rigs thams cad rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin /
translated: They are dedicated to never interrupting any type of aspiration.

original: dus gsum gyi rgyud thams cad ye shes kyis khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi rgyud thams cad ye shes kyis khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa yin /
translated: They are dedicated to comprehending all the continuums of the three times with wisdom.

original: mos pa'i rigs shin tu brtan par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa yin /
analyzed: mos pa'i rigs shin tu brtan par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa yin /
translated: They are dedicated to stabilizing all types of interest.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mang po thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mang po thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin /
translated: They are blessed by many thus-gone ones.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par dgongs pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par dgongs pa yin /
translated: They are contemplated by all buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa yin /
translated: they are the same as all bodhisattvas;

original: 'phags pa thams cad kyis rjes su dgyes par bya ba yin /🔽tshangs pa'i dbang @116b po thams cad kyis mngon par dga' bar byas pa yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad kyis rjes su dgyes par bya ba yin / tshangs pa'i dbang @116b po thams cad kyis mngon par dga' bar byas pa yin /
translated: they are approved by all noble beings;🔽they are approved by all lords of Brahmā;

original: lha'i dbang po thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod pa yin /🔽gnod sbyin gyi dbang po thams cad kyis yongs su bsrung ba yin /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod pa yin / gnod sbyin gyi dbang po thams cad kyis yongs su bsrung ba yin /
translated: they are worshipped by all lords of gods;🔽they are protected by all lords of yakṣas;

original: srin po'i dbang po thams cad kyis rim gror byas pa yin /🔽klu'i dbang po thams cad kyis bsu ba yin /
analyzed: srin po'i dbang po thams cad kyis rim gror byas pa yin / klu'i dbang po thams cad kyis bsu ba yin /
translated: they are served by all lords of rākṣasas;🔽they are welcomed by all lords of nāgas;

original: mi'am ci'i dbang po thams cad kyis mngon par bstod pa yin /
analyzed: mi'am ci'i dbang po thams cad kyis mngon par bstod pa yin /
translated: they are praised by all lords of kinnaras;

original: 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyis yang dag par bsngags pa yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyis yang dag par bsngags pa yin /
translated: they are extolled by all lords of the world;

original: des ni sems can gyi khams thams cad kyang ngan song gi lam rgyud gsum po yongs su bcad pa dang / mi khom pa dang / ngan 'gro'i lam thams cad bzlog pa dang / dbul ba'i lam thams cad las yang dag par bzla ba dang /
analyzed: des ni sems can gyi khams thams cad kyang ngan song gi lam rgyud gsum po yongs su bcad pa dang / mi khom pa dang / ngan 'gro'i lam thams cad bzlog pa dang / dbul ba'i lam thams cad las yang dag par bzla ba dang /
translated: It is also the complete severance of the three continuums of the lower realms for all beings, the reversal of all the paths of the lower realms and the unfavorable states, the complete deliverance from all the paths of poverty,

original: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po mnyan pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi yan lag yongs su dag par bya ba dang /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po mnyan pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi yan lag yongs su dag par bya ba dang /
translated: the attainment of the perfect abundance of gods and humans, the non-separation from the virtuous friend, the non-separation from listening to the vast Dharma of the Buddha, and the purification of the branches of the mind of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam snang ba thob par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas par bya bas dbugs phyin par bya ba yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam snang ba thob par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas par bya bas dbugs phyin par bya ba yin /
translated: It is the complete accomplishment of the cause of the arising of the mind of enlightenment; it is the attainment of the light of the path of the bodhisattva; it is the comprehension of the knowledge of the bodhisattva; it is the relief that comes from abiding in the bodhisattva stages.

original: rigs kyi bu de la bdag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de la bdag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “Noble son, I thought this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams @117a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams @117a *//
translated: ‘Bodhisattvas

original: ni dka' ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: ni dka' ba byed pa ste /
translated: are those who do what is difficult.

original: 'byung bar dka' zhing mthong bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar dka' zhing mthong bar dka' ba'o //
translated: They are difficult to find and difficult to see.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can rnams la bag dro bar byed pas pha dang ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can rnams la bag dro bar byed pas pha dang ma lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like fathers and mothers to beings, for they make them feel at ease.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi rgyan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi rgyan du gyur pa'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are the adornments of the world with its gods.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sdug bsngal gyis mnar ba rnams la skyabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sdug bsngal gyis mnar ba rnams la skyabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are the refuge of those who are tormented by suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are a refuge for all beings in order to protect them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jigs pa sna tshogs kyis gtses pa rnams la dpung gnyen du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jigs pa sna tshogs kyis gtses pa rnams la dpung gnyen du gyur pa'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are a defense for those who are afflicted by various fears.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'gro ba thams cad ngan song gsum du ltung ba las yongs su rton pa'i phyir rlung gi 'khor lo lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'gro ba thams cad ngan song gsum du ltung ba las yongs su rton pa'i phyir rlung gi 'khor lo lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like a wind-wheel for all beings in order to rescue them from falling into the three miserable states.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar byed pas lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar byed pas lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like a cloud for all beings in order to increase the roots of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsod nams rin po che'i mdzod mi zad pa'i gtos dang ldan pas rgya mtsho lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsod nams rin po che'i mdzod mi zad pa'i gtos dang ldan pas rgya mtsho lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like an ocean, because they are a great treasure of inexhaustible jewels of merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ye shes kyi 'od kyis snang bar byed pa'i phyir nyi ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ye shes kyi 'od kyis snang bar byed pa'i phyir nyi ma lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like the sun, because they illuminate with the light of knowledge.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu mtho bas ri rab lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu mtho bas ri rab lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like mountains, for their roots of virtue are very high.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying po byang chub tu ye shes kyi zla ba 'char @117b bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zla ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying po byang chub tu ye shes kyi zla ba 'char @117b bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zla ba lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like the moon, for the moon of wisdom rises in the center of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdud kyi sde thams cad rab tu 'joms pas dpa' bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdud kyi sde thams cad rab tu 'joms pas dpa' bor gyur pa'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are heroes, for they conquer all the hosts of Mara.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang byung gi chos kyi grong khyer du phyin par byed pas rtul phod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang byung gi chos kyi grong khyer du phyin par byed pas rtul phod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like warriors, for they bring about the conquest of the city of self-originated Dharma.🔽Bodhisattvas are like fire, for they dry up the moisture of self-cherishing in all beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi bdag la bya mas ba'i rlan yongs su skem pas me lta bu'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos sprin rgya chen po'i char mngon par 'bebs pas sprin lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi bdag la bya mas ba'i rlan yongs su skem pas me lta bu'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos sprin rgya chen po'i char mngon par 'bebs pas sprin lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like clouds, for they rain down the great Dharma clouds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi dbang po dad pa la sogs pa'i myu gu rnam par 'phel bar byed pas char pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi dbang po dad pa la sogs pa'i myu gu rnam par 'phel bar byed pas char pa lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like rain, causing the sprouts of the faculties of faith and so on of sentient beings to grow.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos rgya mtsho'i 'gram yongs su ston pas mnyan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos rgya mtsho'i 'gram yongs su ston pas mnyan pa lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like sailors, showing the shores of the ocean of the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las yang dag par sgrol ba'i phyir zab pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las yang dag par sgrol ba'i phyir zab pa lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like the deep ocean, because they liberate all sentient beings from the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyis mngon par bgrod par bya ba'i phyir mu stegs lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyis mngon par bgrod par bya ba'i phyir mu stegs lta bu'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are like a ford, because they are the means of crossing over for all sentient beings.

original: de ltar dra byi la sprin gyis tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi mdun du 'dug ste /
analyzed: de ltar dra byi la sprin gyis tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi mdun du 'dug ste /
translated: In this way, Dṛḍhabala, having sat down in front of Sudhana, the head merchant’s son,

original: tshig gi rgyud de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yongs su bsngags pa byas nas /
analyzed: tshig gi rgyud de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yongs su bsngags pa byas nas /
translated: with these verses praised the bodhisattvas.

original: tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la legs so //
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la legs so //
translated: He said, “Excellent, head merchant’s son!

original: zhes bsngags so //
analyzed: zhes bsngags so //
translated: Excellent!

original: de ltar des byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir tshig brjod pa'i @118a *//
analyzed: de ltar des byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir tshig brjod pa'i @118a *//
translated: When he spoke these words to delight the bodhisattvas,

original: tshe; kho'i sgo nas 'od 'phro ba'i phung po rnam pa 'di lta bu byung ste /
analyzed: tshe; kho'i sgo nas 'od 'phro ba'i phung po rnam pa 'di lta bu byung ste /
translated: a mass of light rays like this emerged from his mouth.

original: 'od 'phro ba'i phung po des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par gang bar gyur nas /🔽lha dang / lha rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /🔽klu dang / klu rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba'i phung po des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par gang bar gyur nas / lha dang / lha rdzu 'phrul chen po'am / klu dang / klu rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
translated: That mass of light rays filled the entire trichiliocosm,🔽and the gods and the gods with great magical powers,

original: gnod sbyin dang / gnod sbyin rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang / gnod sbyin rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
translated: the nāgas and the nāgas with great magical powers,🔽the yakṣas and the yakṣas with great magical powers,

original: dri za dang / dri za rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /🔽lha ma yin dang / lha ma yin rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
analyzed: dri za dang / dri za rdzu 'phrul chen po'am / lha ma yin dang / lha ma yin rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
translated: the gandharvas and the gandharvas with great magical powers,🔽the asuras and the asuras with great magical powers,

original: nam mkha' lding dang / nam mkha' lding rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /🔽mi'am ci dang / mi 'am ci rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding dang / nam mkha' lding rdzu 'phrul chen po'am / mi'am ci dang / mi 'am ci rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
translated: the garuḍas and the garuḍas with great magical powers,🔽the kinnaras and the kinnaras with great magical powers,

original: lto 'phye chen po dang / lto 'phye chen po rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po dang / lto 'phye chen po rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
translated: and the mahoragas and the mahoragas with great magical powers

original: mi dang / mi rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
analyzed: mi dang / mi rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
translated: human,🔽or a great human magician,🔽or a nonhuman,

original: mi ma yin pa dang / mi ma yin pa rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa dang / mi ma yin pa rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /
translated: or a great nonhuman magician,🔽or Brahmā,

original: tshangs pa pa dang / tshangs pa rdzu 'phrul chen po'am /🔽sems can gang sus mthong yang rung ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa pa dang / tshangs pa rdzu 'phrul chen po'am / sems can gang sus mthong yang rung ste /
translated: or a great Brahmā magician,🔽or any sentient being,🔽whatever they may be,

original: snang ba des yongs su snang bar byas pa de dag /
analyzed: snang ba des yongs su snang bar byas pa de dag /
translated: who sees that light

original: dra byi la sprin gyi drung du 'ongs so //
analyzed: dra byi la sprin gyi drung du 'ongs so //
translated: will come into the presence of Dṛḍha­lamba­meghā.

original: de nas de ltar dra byi la sprin gyis bsam pa byin gyis brlabs shing thal mo sbyar te gnas pa /
analyzed: de nas de ltar dra byi la sprin gyis bsam pa byin gyis brlabs shing thal mo sbyar te gnas pa /
translated: Then, in this way, Dṛḍha­lamba­meghā blessed the thoughts of those who had assembled, and they stood with palms joined.

original: lus dang sems sim par gyur pa /🔽dga' ba rgya chen po skyes pa /
analyzed: lus dang sems sim par gyur pa / dga' ba rgya chen po skyes pa /
translated: Their bodies and minds were refreshed,🔽and they gave rise to vast joy.

original: sri zhu chen po la gnas pa /
analyzed: sri zhu chen po la gnas pa /
translated: They were established in great respect,

original: nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan bcom pa /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan bcom pa /
translated: had destroyed the banner of pride,

original: g-yo sgyu dang bral ba /
analyzed: g-yo sgyu dang bral ba /
translated: and were free from deceit.

original: dbang po rnam par dang bar gyur pa de dag la /
analyzed: dbang po rnam par dang bar gyur pa de dag la /
translated: Their senses were clear.

original: dra byi la sprin gyis chos kyi rnam grangs yi ge'i 'khor lo'i rgyud kyi rgyan ces bya ba @118b de nyid rgya cher yang dag par bstan te /
analyzed: dra byi la sprin gyis chos kyi rnam grangs yi ge'i 'khor lo'i rgyud kyi rgyan ces bya ba @118b de nyid rgya cher yang dag par bstan te /
translated: Then Megha the Dravidian gave a detailed explanation of the Dharma discourse called The Ornament of the Tantra of the Wheel of Letters.

original: khong du chud pa dang / rtogs pa dang / shes pa dang / rig par byas so //
analyzed: khong du chud pa dang / rtogs pa dang / shes pa dang / rig par byas so //
translated: He caused them to understand, realize, know, and be aware of it.

original: de thos nas kyang de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to //🔽de nas de'i phyir chos kyi stan la 'dug nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de thos nas kyang de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to // de nas de'i phyir chos kyi stan la 'dug nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When they heard it, they all became irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Then, sitting on the Dharma seat, he said to Sudhana, the head merchant’s son, “Noble son,

original: kho bo ni dbyangs dang ldan pa'i gzungs thob pa ste /
analyzed: kho bo ni dbyangs dang ldan pa'i gzungs thob pa ste /
translated: I have attained the dhāraṇī called endowed with melody.

original: de'i mthus kho bo stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i lha rnams kyi lha'i skad kyang shes so //
analyzed: de'i mthus kho bo stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i lha rnams kyi lha'i skad kyang shes so //
translated: By the power of that, I know the divine languages of the gods in this world system of a billion worlds.

original: de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang; dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad kyang shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang; dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad kyang shes so //
translated: In the same way, he understands the Brahmā speech of the nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and Brahmās.

original: lha rnams kyi lha'i skad sna tshogs kyang shes so //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi lha'i skad sna tshogs kyang shes so //
translated: He understands the various divine languages of the gods.

original: de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad sna tshogs kyang shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad sna tshogs kyang shes so //
translated: In the same way, he understands the various Brahmā languages of the nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and Brahmās.

original: lha rnams kyi lha'i skad gcig pa yang shes so //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi lha'i skad gcig pa yang shes so //
translated: He understands the single divine language of the gods.

original: de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad gcig pa yang shes so //🔽lha rnams @119a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad gcig pa yang shes so // lha rnams @119a *//
translated: In the same way, he knows the single language of the nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and Brahmā.

original: kyi lha'i skad tha dad pa yang shes so //
analyzed: kyi lha'i skad tha dad pa yang shes so //

translated: They had no discernment of the different aspects of the realm of phenomena and the different aspects of the realm of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi gzhi dang phyogs kyi bye brag las phyir mi ldog pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gzhi dang phyogs kyi bye brag las phyir mi ldog pa /
translated: They did not turn back from the different aspects of the realm of the world.

original: chos kyi gzhi dang phyogs kyi bye brag las phyir mi ldog pa /
analyzed: chos kyi gzhi dang phyogs kyi bye brag las phyir mi ldog pa /
translated: They did not turn back from the different aspects of the realm of phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas kyi phyogs dang gzhi tha dad pa mthong ba dang / rnam par rig par bya ba la gzhol ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phyogs dang gzhi tha dad pa mthong ba dang / rnam par rig par bya ba la gzhol ba /
translated: They had the vision of the different aspects of the buddhas and the different aspects of the ground.

original: dus kyi phyogs dang gzhi'i bye brag khong du chud pa'i ye shes can /
analyzed: dus kyi phyogs dang gzhi'i bye brag khong du chud pa'i ye shes can /
translated: They had the wisdom that comprehended the different aspects of time and the ground.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo yid du 'ong bas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i blo dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo yid du 'ong bas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i blo dang ldan pa /
translated: They had the intelligence that was accomplished through the pleasant turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: ye shes kun nas snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa snang bas sems gsal bar byas pa /
analyzed: ye shes kun nas snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa snang bas sems gsal bar byas pa /
translated: They had minds that were illuminated by the light of the aspect of the samādhi of the appearance of omniscience.

original: yid kyi lus yul kun dang ldan pa'i sa la zhugs pa /
analyzed: yid kyi lus yul kun dang ldan pa'i sa la zhugs pa /
translated: They had entered the bhūmi of the mental body that has all objects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang bas rgyud shin tu snang bar byas pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang bas rgyud shin tu snang bar byas pa /
translated: They had the continuum of the light of the wisdom of the tathāgatas.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dad pa'i dba' rlabs kyi shugs kyis rab tu slob pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dad pa'i dba' rlabs kyi shugs kyis rab tu slob pa /
translated: They were training through the power of the waves of faith in omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa'i shugs dang 'bral ba med pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa'i shugs dang 'bral ba med pa /
translated: They were never separated from the power of devotion to the Dharma of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs pa /
translated: They were empowered by the blessing of the tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad rang gi sems kyi rgyud du khong du chud pa'i @122a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad rang gi sems kyi rgyud du khong du chud pa'i @122a *//
translated: He had the realization that all the buddhas were within his own mindstream.

original: 'od kyis snang bar gyur pa /
analyzed: 'od kyis snang bar gyur pa /
translated: He was illuminated by light.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dra ba thams cad rang gi lus kyis rgyas par dgang ba'i smon lam dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad rang gi lus su yang dag par bsdu ba dang mngon par bsgrubs pa la brtson pa de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dra ba thams cad rang gi lus kyis rgyas par dgang ba'i smon lam dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad rang gi lus su yang dag par bsdu ba dang mngon par bsgrubs pa la brtson pa de /
translated: He had the aspiration to fill the entire network of world systems with his own body, and he was dedicated to the accomplishment of gathering the entire realm of phenomena into his own body.

original: mthar gyis song song ste /
analyzed: mthar gyis song song ste /
translated: He went and went,

original: lo bcu gnyis kyis yul nags tshal na gnas par phyin nas /
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis kyis yul nags tshal na gnas par phyin nas /
translated: until after twelve years he arrived at the place called Forest Dwelling.

original: des tshong dpon btang brjod de btsal btsal te mthong ngo //
analyzed: des tshong dpon btang brjod de btsal btsal te mthong ngo //
translated: He searched for the merchant Muktaka and saw him.

original: mthong nas kyang lus thams cad kyis phab ste /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang lus thams cad kyis phab ste /
translated: When he saw him, he fell at his feet,

original: phyag 'tshal nas mdun du 'dug ste /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas mdun du 'dug ste /
translated: prostrated to him, and sat down in front of him.

original: thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: With his hands placed together in homage, he said,

original: 'phags pa / bdag de ring dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mjal bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa / bdag de ring dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mjal bar gyur pa ni /
translated: “Ārya, today I have met with a spiritual friend.

original: bdag gis 'thob par bgyi ba legs par thob bo //
analyzed: bdag gis 'thob par bgyi ba legs par thob bo //
translated: I have attained what I needed to attain.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni mthong bar dka' ba'o //🔽'byung bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni mthong bar dka' ba'o // 'byung bar dka' ba'o //
translated: It is because it is difficult to see the kalyāṇamitras.🔽It is difficult to appear.

original: mjal bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: mjal bar dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to meet.

original: bgrod par dka' ba'o //🔽bsnyen bkur bgyi bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: bgrod par dka' ba'o // bsnyen bkur bgyi bar dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to travel to.🔽It is difficult to serve.

original: mnyes par bgyi ba dka' ba'o //🔽'grogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: mnyes par bgyi ba dka' ba'o // 'grogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to please.🔽It is difficult to accompany.

original: rim gror bgyi ba dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rim gror bgyi ba dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to attend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni rjes su 'brang bar dka' ba lags na /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni rjes su 'brang bar dka' ba lags na /
translated: It is difficult to follow the kalyāṇamitras.

original: de lta bu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'grogs pa de ring bdag gis thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'grogs pa de ring bdag gis thob par gyur to //
translated: Today I have obtained the company of such a kalyāṇamitra.

original: 'phags pa / bdag gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa / bdag gis 'di lta ste /
translated: Ārya, it is like this:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la bsnyen bkur ba dang / sangs rgyas @122b thams cad la rim gror bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhal blta ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par dmigs par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid thob par bgyi ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la bsnyen bkur ba dang / sangs rgyas @122b thams cad la rim gror bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhal blta ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par dmigs par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid thob par bgyi ba dang /
translated: to serve all the buddhas, to honor all the buddhas, to behold the faces of all the buddhas, to perceive all the buddhas, to attain the state of equality with all the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam khong du chud par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par bsgrub pa'i ye shes snang bar bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad rang gi lus su mngon par bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam khong du chud par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par bsgrub pa'i ye shes snang bar bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad rang gi lus su mngon par bsgrub pa dang /
translated: to understand the aspirations of all the buddhas, to fulfill the aspirations of all the buddhas, to manifest the wisdom of the accomplishment of all the buddhas, to manifest in my own body all the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par bsgrubs pa rang gi spyod par mngon par bsgrub par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba mngon sum du rtogs par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi stobs dang mi bsnyengs pa yongs su dag par bgyi ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par bsgrubs pa rang gi spyod par mngon par bsgrub par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba mngon sum du rtogs par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi stobs dang mi bsnyengs pa yongs su dag par bgyi ba dang /
translated: I will purify the strengths and fearlessnesses of all the buddhas;🔽I will listen to the teachings of all the buddhas without ever being satisfied;🔽I will listen to and uphold the teachings of all the buddhas;

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa mnyan pas mi ngoms par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos brtan pa mnyan cing blang bar bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa yang dag par gzung bar bgyi ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa mnyan pas mi ngoms par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos brtan pa mnyan cing blang bar bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa yang dag par gzung bar bgyi ba dang /
translated: I will uphold the teachings of all the buddhas;

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa rnam par dbye bar bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa yongs su gzung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang tshul gcig tu 'gyur bar bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang @123a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa rnam par dbye bar bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa yongs su gzung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang tshul gcig tu 'gyur bar bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang @123a *//
translated: to be of the same nature as all bodhisattvas,🔽to be of the same fortune as all bodhisattvas,🔽to purify the conduct of all bodhisattvas,🔽to perfect the perfections of all bodhisattvas,

original: skal pa mnyam par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa yongs su dag par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa rnam par dag par bgyi ba dang /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa yongs su dag par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa rnam par dag par bgyi ba dang /
translated: to purify the accomplishment of the aspirations of all bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mdzod rab tu thob par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos kyi gter dang mdzod mi zad pa'i ye shes snang ba thob par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ting 'dzin gyi gter dang mdzod khong du chud par bgyi ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mdzod rab tu thob par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos kyi gter dang mdzod mi zad pa'i ye shes snang ba thob par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ting 'dzin gyi gter dang mdzod khong du chud par bgyi ba dang /
translated: to attain the treasury of the buddhas’ blessings of all bodhisattvas,🔽to attain the wisdom light of the inexhaustible treasury of the Dharma of all bodhisattvas,🔽to comprehend the treasury of the samādhis of all bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mdzod tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi snying rje chen po'i gter dang mdzod sems can 'dul ba'i mthar phyin par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i gter dang mdzod rnam par dmigs par bgyi ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mdzod tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi snying rje chen po'i gter dang mdzod sems can 'dul ba'i mthar phyin par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i gter dang mdzod rnam par dmigs par bgyi ba dang /
translated: to accomplish the immeasurable treasury of all bodhisattvas,🔽to perfect the taming of beings through the treasury of the great compassion of all bodhisattvas,🔽and to perceive the treasury of the miracles of all bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dbang gi gter dang mdzod rang gi sems kyi dbang du bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa'i gter dang mdzod rnam pa thams cad du brgyan par bgyi ba'i slad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dbang gi gter dang mdzod rang gi sems kyi dbang du bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa'i gter dang mdzod rnam pa thams cad du brgyan par bgyi ba'i slad du /
translated: I have generated the mind of unsurpassed, perfect awakening in order to become the treasure and mine of the power of all bodhisattvas, to bring all under the power of my mind,

original: bla na med pa yang @123b dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang @123b dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: and to become the treasure and mine of the purity of all bodhisattvas, in order to adorn them in every way.

original: 'phags pa / de lta bu'i sems kyis bdag 'dir mchis so //
analyzed: 'phags pa / de lta bu'i sems kyis bdag 'dir mchis so //
translated: Noble one, I have come here with such a mind.

original: bsam pa de lta bu dang / yid la smon pa de lta bu dang / mngon par dga' ba de lta bu dang / sems pa de lta bu dang / gdon mi 'tshal bar bsgrub par bsam pa de lta bu dang / spyod yul mngon du bgyi ba de lta bu dang /
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu dang / yid la smon pa de lta bu dang / mngon par dga' ba de lta bu dang / sems pa de lta bu dang / gdon mi 'tshal bar bsgrub par bsam pa de lta bu dang / spyod yul mngon du bgyi ba de lta bu dang /
translated: With such an intention, such a wish, such delight, such a mind, such a determination to accomplish, such a field of activity to manifest,

original: tshul khong du chud par bgyi ba la mos pa de lta bu dang / rnam par dag pa la gzhol ba de lta bu dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i bsam pa de lta bu dang / rab tu gzhol ba'i sems de lta bu dang / dge ba'i sbyor ba de lta bu dang /
analyzed: tshul khong du chud par bgyi ba la mos pa de lta bu dang / rnam par dag pa la gzhol ba de lta bu dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i bsam pa de lta bu dang / rab tu gzhol ba'i sems de lta bu dang / dge ba'i sbyor ba de lta bu dang /
translated: I have come here with such an aspiration to understand, such a dedication to purity, such an analytical intention, such a focused mind, such a virtuous application,

original: mngon du gyur pa'i dbang po de lta bus bdag 'dir mchis te /
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa'i dbang po de lta bus bdag 'dir mchis te /
translated: and such manifest faculties.

original: 'phags pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni /
translated: Noble one,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang rjes su ston pa mdzad cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang rjes su ston pa mdzad cing /
translated: you give instructions and teachings to bodhisattvas.

original: tshul ni nye bar ston pa mdzad /
analyzed: tshul ni nye bar ston pa mdzad /
translated: You reveal the way.

original: rtogs par bgyi ba ni snang bar mdzad /
analyzed: rtogs par bgyi ba ni snang bar mdzad /
translated: You illuminate what is to be realized.

original: lam ni bstan par mdzad /
analyzed: lam ni bstan par mdzad /
translated: You show the path.

original: mu stegs la ni 'jog par mdzad /
analyzed: mu stegs la ni 'jog par mdzad /
translated: You establish them in the right path.

original: chos kyi sgo ni rnam par 'byed pa mdzad /🔽the tshom ni yongs su gcod par mdzad /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo ni rnam par 'byed pa mdzad / the tshom ni yongs su gcod par mdzad /
translated: You open the door of the Dharma.🔽You cut through their doubts.

original: nem nur ni sel bar mdzad /🔽yid gnyis kyi zug rngu ni 'byin par mdzad /
analyzed: nem nur ni sel bar mdzad / yid gnyis kyi zug rngu ni 'byin par mdzad /
translated: You clear away their uncertainty.🔽You extract the thorn of doubt.

original: dogs pa'i dri ma ni sbyong bar mdzad /
analyzed: dogs pa'i dri ma ni sbyong bar mdzad /
translated: You purify the stains of hesitation.

original: sems kyi thibs po ni snang bar mdzad; sems kyi dri ma ni yongs su sel bar mdzad /
analyzed: sems kyi thibs po ni snang bar mdzad; sems kyi dri ma ni yongs su sel bar mdzad /
translated: He removes the stains of the mind.

original: sems kyi rgyud ni rab tu dang bar mdzad /🔽sems kyi g-yo sgyu ni yongs su sel bar mdzad /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud ni rab tu dang bar mdzad / sems kyi g-yo sgyu ni yongs su sel bar mdzad /
translated: He purifies the continuum of the mind.🔽He removes the deceptions of the mind.

original: sems kyi gdung ba ni yongs su @124a *//🔽sim par mdzad /
analyzed: sems kyi gdung ba ni yongs su @124a *// sim par mdzad /
translated: He removes the torments of the mind.

original: 'khor ba las ni sems rnam par bzlog par mdzad /
analyzed: 'khor ba las ni sems rnam par bzlog par mdzad /
translated: He turns the mind away from saṃsāra.

original: mi dge ba'i las ni phyir bzlog par mdzad /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las ni phyir bzlog par mdzad /
translated: He turns the mind away from nonvirtuous actions.

original: sems can dmyal ba las ni ldog par mdzad /🔽gnas dang ni dbral bar mdzad /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba las ni ldog par mdzad / gnas dang ni dbral bar mdzad /
translated: He turns the mind away from the hells.🔽He removes the mind from its abode.

original: mngon par zhen pa las ni gyen du bskyod pa mdzad /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa las ni gyen du bskyod pa mdzad /
translated: He raises the mind above its attachments.

original: chags pa thams cad las ni yongs su 'grel ba mdzad /
analyzed: chags pa thams cad las ni yongs su 'grel ba mdzad /
translated: He delivers the mind from all attachments.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ni bsgrub pa mdzad /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ni bsgrub pa mdzad /
translated: He establishes the mind in omniscience.

original: chos kyi grong khyer du 'jug par bgyi ba'i slad du ni mngon du gyur par mdzad /
analyzed: chos kyi grong khyer du 'jug par bgyi ba'i slad du ni mngon du gyur par mdzad /
translated: He makes the mind enter the city of the Dharma.

original: snying rje chen po la ni rab tu bsgrub pa mdzad /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la ni rab tu bsgrub pa mdzad /
translated: He establishes the mind in great compassion.

original: byams pa chen po la ni rab tu gzhog pa mdzad /
analyzed: byams pa chen po la ni rab tu gzhog pa mdzad /
translated: He establishes them in great love.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la ni rab tu sbyor ba mdzad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la ni rab tu sbyor ba mdzad /
translated: He connects them to the bodhisattva way of life.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsgom pa la ni 'dzud pa mdzad /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsgom pa la ni 'dzud pa mdzad /
translated: He introduces them to the cultivation of the door of samādhis.

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo la ni gnas par mdzad /
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo la ni gnas par mdzad /
translated: He establishes them in the door of realization.

original: rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa la ni gzhog par mdzad /
analyzed: rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa la ni gzhog par mdzad /
translated: He connects them to the realization of the nature.

original: stobs dang ldan pas ni khyab par mdzad /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pas ni khyab par mdzad /
translated: He pervades them with strength.

original: 'gro ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ni sems rnam par dbye ba mdzad do zhes thos na /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ni sems rnam par dbye ba mdzad do zhes thos na /
translated: He causes them to have an impartial attitude toward all beings.

original: 'phags pa / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la brtson par bgyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la brtson par bgyi /
translated: “Ārya, how should bodhisattvas be diligent in bodhisattva conduct?

original: ji ltar sbyar bar bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyar bar bgyi /
translated: How should they apply themselves?

original: ji ltar brtson par bgyis na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam par dag par 'gyur ba bdag la bstan du gsol /
analyzed: ji ltar brtson par bgyis na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam par dag par 'gyur ba bdag la bstan du gsol /
translated: How should they be diligent so that the maṇḍala of bodhisattva conduct becomes pure? Please teach me.”

original: de nas tshong dpon btang brjod kyis de'i tshe byang @124b chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba gzungs kyi sgo klong mtha' yas pa sngon du 'gro ba la sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon btang brjod kyis de'i tshe byang @124b chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba gzungs kyi sgo klong mtha' yas pa sngon du 'gro ba la sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i
translated: He did so through the power of his previously planted roots of virtue,

original: shugs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas yang dag par bsams shing /
analyzed: shugs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas yang dag par bsams shing /
translated: the blessings of the thus-gone ones, and the encouragement of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: ye shes snang ba nye bar bsgrubs pas snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: ye shes snang ba nye bar bsgrubs pas snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: He entered this absorption by accomplishing the light of wisdom.

original: tshong dpon btang brjod de ltar snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu gzugs kyi lus yongs su dag pa rnam pa 'di lta bur gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: tshong dpon btang brjod de ltar snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu gzugs kyi lus yongs su dag pa rnam pa 'di lta bur gnas par gyur te /
translated: As soon as the merchant Muktaka entered this absorption, his physical body became pure and took on the following appearance.

original: lus yongs su dag pa de'i mthus phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: lus yongs su dag pa de'i mthus phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Through the power of that pure body, the blessed buddhas of the ten directions

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang bcas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang bcas /
translated: They were as numerous as the atoms in ten buddha realms, and they were all completely pure buddha realms.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas /
translated: They were all surrounded by circles of retinues.

original: 'od rnam par dag pa dang bcas /
analyzed: 'od rnam par dag pa dang bcas /
translated: They were all completely pure lights.

original: sngon spyod pa la zhugs pa dang bcas /
analyzed: sngon spyod pa la zhugs pa dang bcas /
translated: They were all engaged in previous conduct.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang bcas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang bcas /
translated: They were all emanations of buddhas.

original: smon lam gyi tshogs dang bcas /
analyzed: smon lam gyi tshogs dang bcas /
translated: They were all accumulations of aspirations.

original: spyod pa dang 'byung ba'i rgyan rnam par dag pa dang bcas /
analyzed: spyod pa dang 'byung ba'i rgyan rnam par dag pa dang bcas /
translated: They were all completely pure adornments of conduct and origin.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yongs su ston pa dang bcas /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yongs su ston pa dang bcas /
translated: They were all displays of the attainment of complete buddhahood.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo shin tu ston pa dang bcas /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo shin tu ston pa dang bcas /
translated: They were all completely teaching the wheel of the Dharma.

original: sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang bcas /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang bcas /
translated: They were all ripening beings.🔽They were all the culmination of the end of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi mu'i mthar thug pa dang bcas par kun kyang lus kyi khong du chud cing 'dus par snang ste /
analyzed: chos kyi mu'i mthar thug pa dang bcas par kun kyang lus kyi khong du chud cing 'dus par snang ste /
translated: All of them were seen to be within the body of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: de dag kyang phan tshun ma 'dres pa dang / phan tshun mchod pa dang / phan tshun shin tu rnam par @125a *//
analyzed: de dag kyang phan tshun ma 'dres pa dang / phan tshun mchod pa dang / phan tshun shin tu rnam par @125a *//
translated: They were distinct from each other,

original: phye ba dang / phan tshun shin tu rnam par gnas pa dang / tshul sna tshogs su bzhugs pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgyan sna tshogs can mnga' ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs kyi rgyan dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: phye ba dang / phan tshun shin tu rnam par gnas pa dang / tshul sna tshogs su bzhugs pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgyan sna tshogs can mnga' ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs kyi rgyan dang ldan pa dang /
translated: they were mutually worshiped, they were mutually distinguished, they were mutually well-established, they were situated in various ways, they were perceived in their true nature, they possessed various adornments of buddha-fields, and they possessed the various adornments of the circles of bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs su yongs su ston par snang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs su yongs su ston par snang ngo //
translated: They were seen to manifest various miracles of the buddhas.

original: theg pa sna tshogs rnam par dgod pa mdzad pa dang / smon lam gyi sgo sna tshogs yongs su brjod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams la la na ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang du skyes shing /
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs rnam par dgod pa mdzad pa dang / smon lam gyi sgo sna tshogs yongs su brjod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams la la na ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang du skyes shing /
translated: They were seen to establish various vehicles, to proclaim various gateways of vows, and in some world systems to be born in the Tuṣita Palace,

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad mdzad par snang ngo //🔽la la na ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'pho ba dang / la la na ni yum gyi sku na bzhugs shing rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs yongs su ston pa dang / la la na ni skye ba dang / la la na ni byis pa'i rtsed mo ston pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad mdzad par snang ngo // la la na ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'pho ba dang / la la na ni yum gyi sku na bzhugs shing rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs yongs su ston pa dang / la la na ni skye ba dang / la la na ni byis pa'i rtsed mo ston pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: He appears to perform all the activities of a buddha.🔽In some he is seen passing away from the Tuṣita Palace, in some he is seen in his mother’s womb displaying various miracles, in some he is seen taking birth, in some he is seen as a child displaying childish games,

original: la la na ni btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / la la na ni mngon par 'byung ba dang / la la na ni snying po byang chub tu gshegs te rnam par 'phrul ba'i rgyan chen pos bdud kyi sde pham par mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: la la na ni btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / la la na ni mngon par 'byung ba dang / la la na ni snying po byang chub tu gshegs te rnam par 'phrul ba'i rgyan chen pos bdud kyi sde pham par mdzad pa dang /
translated: in some he is seen living in the royal palace, in some he is seen going forth, in some he is seen going to the seat of awakening and defeating the hordes of demons with the great display of miracles,

original: la la na ni lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri zas yongs su bskor cing tshangs pa'i dbang pos chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba gdab pa dang / la la na ni @125b chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: la la na ni lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri zas yongs su bskor cing tshangs pa'i dbang pos chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba gdab pa dang / la la na ni @125b chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mdzad pa dang /
translated: In some, the turning of the wheel of Dharma was seen.

original: la la na ni sems can thams cad kyi gnas na bzhugs pa dang / la la na ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar snang ngo //
analyzed: la la na ni sems can thams cad kyi gnas na bzhugs pa dang / la la na ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar snang ngo //
translated: In some, the Tathāgata was seen dwelling in the abodes of all beings, and in some, he was seen passing into parinirvāṇa.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams la la na ni de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi ring bsrel rnam par 'god par snang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams la la na ni de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi ring bsrel rnam par 'god par snang ngo //
translated: In some world systems, the Tathāgata was seen arranging the relics of the tathāgatas who had passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni lha dang mi rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la rgyan gyis klubs pa byed par snang ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni lha dang mi rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la rgyan gyis klubs pa byed par snang ste /
translated: In some buddhafields, the gods and humans were seen adorning the stūpas of the tathāgatas with ornaments.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis sems can gyi ris rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi lam rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi skye gnas rnam pa tha dad pa dang /🔽sems can gyi tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi lam gyi rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi bsam pa'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis sems can gyi ris rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi lam rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi skye gnas rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi lam gyi rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi bsam pa'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang /
translated: They know the different kinds of beings, the different kinds of worlds of beings, the different kinds of paths of beings, the different kinds of wombs of beings,🔽the different kinds of groups of beings, the different kinds of continuums of beings’ roots of virtue, the different kinds of continuums of beings’ paths, the different kinds of continuums of beings’ thoughts,

original: sems can gyi mos pa'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / dus kyi rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi las kyi bye brag rnam pa tha dad pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi mos pa'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / dus kyi rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi las kyi bye brag rnam pa tha dad pa dang /
translated: the different kinds of continuums of beings’ aspirations, the different kinds of continuums of beings’ faculties, the different kinds of continuums of time, and the different kinds of continuums of beings’ different kinds of karma.

original: sems can gyi las mi mthun pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten rnam par dbye ba rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi tshul lam dang / spyod pa rnam pa @126a *//
analyzed: sems can gyi las mi mthun pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten rnam par dbye ba rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi tshul lam dang / spyod pa rnam pa @126a *//
translated: the different karmic actions of beings, the different classifications of the world of beings, the different ways of life and conduct of beings,

original: tha dad pa la rnam par spyod pa dang / sems can rgya mtsho bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa dang / dbang po mi mthun pa sna tshogs rnam par dag pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags sna tshogs bag la nyal bar gyur pa'i sems can 'byams klas pa rnams la /
analyzed: tha dad pa la rnam par spyod pa dang / sems can rgya mtsho bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa dang / dbang po mi mthun pa sna tshogs rnam par dag pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags sna tshogs bag la nyal bar gyur pa'i sems can 'byams klas pa rnams la /
translated: the different aspirations and practices of the ocean of beings, the various different pure faculties, and the various different afflictions and latent tendencies of beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su bstan pa dang / yul sna tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / gsung rnam pa sna tshogs su bsgrub pa dang / mdo sde sna tshogs kyi tshul rab tu brjod pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su bstan pa dang / yul sna tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / gsung rnam pa sna tshogs su bsgrub pa dang / mdo sde sna tshogs kyi tshul rab tu brjod pa dang /
translated: the various different displays of the buddhas, the various different definitions of the realms, the various different melodies and voices, the various different teachings of the sūtras,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyud dang / tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa'i tshul gyi gzhung sna tshogs dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa'i ming rgya mtsho'i rgyud rnam pa sna tshogs dang / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog dang / seng ge'i nga ro rab tu bsgrags pa dang /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyud dang / tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa'i tshul gyi gzhung sna tshogs dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa'i ming rgya mtsho'i rgyud rnam pa sna tshogs dang / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog dang / seng ge'i nga ro rab tu bsgrags pa dang /
translated: the tantra of the different dhāraṇī gateways, the various scriptures of the way of knowing the different, the various tantras of the ocean of names of the noble truths, the lion’s roar of the Buddha, the lion’s roar of the proclamation,

original: sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yongs su bstan pa dang / dran pa'i sgo sna tshogs can shin tu bstan pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan pa'i seng ge'i nga ro sna tshogs dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yongs su bstan pa dang / dran pa'i sgo sna tshogs can shin tu bstan pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan pa'i seng ge'i nga ro sna tshogs dang /
translated: the display of the miracle of teaching the various roots of virtue of beings, the display of the various ways of teaching through various doors of mindfulness, and the various lion’s roars of the bodhisattvas’ prophecies.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i mthu phyung ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mtha' dang / dbus med pa mtha' yas par rnam pa tha dad pa phan tshun mchod pa dang / rnam par @126b dag pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs yangs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i mthu phyung ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mtha' dang / dbus med pa mtha' yas par rnam pa tha dad pa phan tshun mchod pa dang / rnam par @126b dag pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs yangs pa dang /
translated: In the same way, the various powers of the Dharma wheel of the tathagatas manifest in infinite, limitless maṇḍalas of retinues, with different aspects, mutually worshiping each other, and with various vast, pure maṇḍalas of retinues.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor shin tu phra bar 'dus pa dang / dpag tshad gcig gi tshad tsam dang / dpag tshad bcu'i tshad tsam dang / dpag tshad brgya'i tshad tsam nas /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor shin tu phra bar 'dus pa dang / dpag tshad gcig gi tshad tsam dang / dpag tshad bcu'i tshad tsam dang / dpag tshad brgya'i tshad tsam nas /
translated: There are extremely subtle maṇḍalas of retinues, the size of one yojana, the size of ten yojanas, the size of a hundred yojanas,

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi tshad tsam du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi tshad tsam du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis /
translated: up to the size of the maṇḍalas of retinues of world systems equal to the number of atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya of buddha realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsungs dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bas chos ji snyed du bstan pa de dag thams cad kyang tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis thos so //🔽blangs so // yang dag par bzung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsungs dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bas chos ji snyed du bstan pa de dag thams cad kyang tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis thos so // blangs so // yang dag par bzung ngo //
translated: He heard all the teachings of the Dharma that were being given by the speech of the Tathāgata, which was in accord with the faculties, aspirations, and natures of all beings, and which was the voice of the Tathāgata that went everywhere.

original: bsams so // sangs rgyas kyi sa rnam par 'phrul pa de dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: bsams so // sangs rgyas kyi sa rnam par 'phrul pa de dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He received them, he took them up, he held them, he reflected on them, and he contemplated them.🔽He saw the miracles of the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba de dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba de dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He saw the bodhisattvas’ power of samādhi.

original: de nas tshong dpon btang brjod dran zhing shes bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas /
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon btang brjod dran zhing shes bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas /

analyzed: tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so // rigs kyi bu / kho bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa /
translated: and said to the head merchant’s son Sudhana, “Noble one,

analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i rgyan ces bya ba yongs su blangs shing 'dzin pa ste /
translated: I have received and hold the tathāgatas’ liberation called the display of unobstructed adornments.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble one,

original: de ltar kho bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa thogs pa med pa'i rgyan de la rtog cing dpyod pa'i tshe /🔽shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten @127a *//
analyzed: de ltar kho bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa thogs pa med pa'i rgyan de la rtog cing dpyod pa'i tshe / shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten @127a *//
translated: “When I was contemplating and examining the display of the tathāgatas’ unimpeded liberation,

analyzed: gyi khams 'dzam bu chu klung gi mdog dang ldan pa na /
translated: in the eastern world realm Endowed with the Color of the Jambu River,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skar ma'i dbang phyug rgyal po zhes bya ba /

analyzed: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams stobs thams cad kyi shugs dang ldan pa na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas spos kun tu rnam par yangs pa zhes bya ba /
translated: I saw the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha All-Pervading Fragrance,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa yang mig lam du snang ngo //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa @127b dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdo rje rab tu 'dul ba zhes bya ba /

translated: He saw the adornment of all the infinite world systems, the delight of all sentient beings, and the worship of all the buddhas filling all the realms of phenomena in every instant.

analyzed: lha ma yin gyi sgyus rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu ston cing /

analyzed: chu 'dzin chen po yongs su bskyab pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong rab tu bskyod @135b pa dang / ri'i rgyal po chen po thams cad 'thab par bya ba dang / lha'i gnas thams cad yongs su bskyod pa dang / bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad zil gyis mnan pa dang /
translated: to protect the great clouds, to shake a hundred thousand world systems, to make all the great kings of mountains fight, to shake all the abodes of the gods, to overpower all the maṇḍalas of Māra,

translated: to subdue all the armies of Māra, to conquer all pride, conceit, and arrogance, to turn away the minds of those who wish to harm and make them happy, to turn away the minds of those who wish to harm,

original: sems can rnams kyi mi dge ba'i chos rab tu zhi bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i ri rnam par gtor bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'thab mo shin tu zhi bar bya ba dang / lha ma yin gyi sgyus rnam par 'phrul pa dang /🔽rnam par rtse ba sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams skyo bar bya ba dang / sdig pa las gyen du bskyod pa dang / 'khor pas 'jigs par bya ba dang / srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud thams cad nas gyen du bskyod de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mi dge ba'i chos rab tu zhi bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i ri rnam par gtor bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'thab mo shin tu zhi bar bya ba dang / lha ma yin gyi sgyus rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rnam par rtse ba sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams skyo bar bya ba dang / sdig pa las gyen du bskyod pa dang / 'khor pas 'jigs par bya ba dang / srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud thams cad nas gyen du bskyod de /
translated: He did so in order to pacify the nonvirtuous qualities of sentient beings, to destroy the mountains of their afflictions, to completely pacify the battles of their afflictions, and to inspire sentient beings with various magical displays and playful emanations of the asuras.🔽He did so in order to turn sentient beings away from evil, to frighten them with saṃsāra, to turn them away from all the realms of existence,

original: gnas med pa la rab tu gnas par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi sems la sems can rnams rab tu dgod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu dgod par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gnas med pa la rab tu gnas par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi sems la sems can rnams rab tu dgod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu dgod par bya ba dang /
translated: to establish them in the absence of a basis, to establish sentient beings in the mind of awakening, to purify the bodhisattva conduct of bodhisattvas, to establish bodhisattvas in the perfections,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la rab tu gzud pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi @136a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la rab tu gzud pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi @136a *//
translated: He saw him guiding beings to the bodhisattva levels,

original: tshul snang ba yongs su bskyed pa dang / chos kyi tshul rnam par dgod pa sna tshogs kyis sems kyi skad cig re re zhing chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs par byed pa /

translated: causing the light of the buddhadharmas of the bodhisattvas to appear, and filling the realm of phenomena with various arrays of the Dharma in every instant of mind.

original: tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo //
translated: Sudhana, the head merchant’s son, saw him.

original: rgyab kyi gzhung nas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas mang po sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas /
analyzed: rgyab kyi gzhung nas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas mang po sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas /
translated: From his back came forth many śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, as numerous as the atoms in countless buddha realms,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa rnams la bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa yongs su rjod par byed cing /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa rnams la bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa yongs su rjod par byed cing /
translated: and they were teaching selflessness and the absence of a being to those beings who were to be guided by śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and who were fixated on a self.

original: rtag par mngon par zhen pa rnams la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par yongs su bstan pa dang / 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can rnams la mi sdug pa dang / zhe sdang gi spyod pa can rnams la byams pa dang / gti mug gi spyod pa can rnams la rkyen las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba brjod pa dang /
analyzed: rtag par mngon par zhen pa rnams la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par yongs su bstan pa dang / 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can rnams la mi sdug pa dang / zhe sdang gi spyod pa can rnams la byams pa dang / gti mug gi spyod pa can rnams la rkyen las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba brjod pa dang /
translated: To those who cling to permanence, they teach that all formations are impermanent.🔽To those who engage in desire, they teach repulsiveness. To those who engage in anger, they teach love. To those who engage in ignorance, they teach the dependent origination that arises from conditions.

original: cha mnyam pa'i spyod pa can rnams la ye shes kyi yul dang ldan pa'i chos kyi tshul mngon par bstan pa dang / yul la mngon par dga' ba rnams la gnas med pa rab tu brjod pa dang / zhi ba la gnas su sems pa rnams la smon lam gyi khyad par gyis spro ba bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: cha mnyam pa'i spyod pa can rnams la ye shes kyi yul dang ldan pa'i chos kyi tshul mngon par bstan pa dang / yul la mngon par dga' ba rnams la gnas med pa rab tu brjod pa dang / zhi ba la gnas su sems pa rnams la smon lam gyi khyad par gyis spro ba bskyed pa dang /
