analyzed: dngul gyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od gser gyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / gser gyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od shel gyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / gser gyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od mu tig dmar po'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / aasma gar bha'i rang bzhin gyi @139a *//
translated: In the silver fields, golden light radiates. In the golden fields, crystal light radiates. In the golden fields, red pearl light radiates.🔽In the emerald fields, golden light radiates.

original: zhing rnams su 'od gser gyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / gser gyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od aasma gar bha'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / aindra n'i la'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che'i rgyal po nyi ma'i snying po'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang /
analyzed: zhing rnams su 'od gser gyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / gser gyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od aasma gar bha'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / aindra n'i la'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che'i rgyal po nyi ma'i snying po'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang /
translated: In the golden fields, emerald light radiates. In the sapphire fields, the light of the essence of the sun jewel king radiates.

original: rin po che'i rgyal po nyi ma'i snying po'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che'i aindra n'i la'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / mu tig dmar po'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che'i rgyal po zla ba'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang /
analyzed: rin po che'i rgyal po nyi ma'i snying po'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che'i aindra n'i la'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / mu tig dmar po'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che'i rgyal po zla ba'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang /
translated: In the buddhafields that have the nature of the king of jewels, the essence of the sun, he radiates light that has the color of the jewel indranīla.🔽In the buddhafields that have the nature of red pearls, he radiates light that has the color of the king of jewels, the light rays of the moon, and the essence of the center of the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / rin po che'i rgyal po zla ba'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od mu tig dmar po kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / rin po che'i rgyal po zla ba'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od mu tig dmar po kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang /
translated: In the buddhafields that have the nature of the king of jewels, the light rays of the moon, and the essence of the center of the maṇḍala, he radiates light that has the color of red pearls.

original: rin po che gcig gi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che sna tshogs kyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che gcig gi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang /
analyzed: rin po che gcig gi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che sna tshogs kyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che gcig gi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang /
translated: In buddhafields that are of the nature of a single jewel, light of various jewel colors radiates. In buddhafields that are of the nature of various jewels, light of the color of a single jewel radiates.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du sems can gyi don tshad med pa la brtson zhing chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du sems can gyi don tshad med pa la brtson zhing chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, Sudhana saw that in all the maṇḍalas of the assemblies of bodhisattvas, they were working for the benefit of countless beings and filling the realm of phenomena.

original: smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas zla ba mang po sangs rgyas kyi zhing @139b grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas /
analyzed: smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas zla ba mang po sangs rgyas kyi zhing @139b grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas /
translated: From the ūrṇā hair between his eyebrows, many moons emerged, equal in number to the atoms in countless buddha realms.

original: lha'i dbang po thams cad zil gyis gnon cing /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po thams cad zil gyis gnon cing /
translated: They outshone all the lords of the gods.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i dga' ba rnam par bzlog pa dang / sangs rgyas blta bar dga' ba la rjes su bsngags par byed cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i dga' ba rnam par bzlog pa dang / sangs rgyas blta bar dga' ba la rjes su bsngags par byed cing /
translated: He saw them turning away from all worldly pleasures and praising the delight of seeing the Buddha.

original: sems can tshad med pa gdul ba la brtson par phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa gdul ba la brtson par phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa mthong ngo //
translated: They were filling the whole realm of phenomena in the ten directions with the effort to guide countless beings.

original: dpral ba nas tshangs pa chen po spyod lam rab tu zhi ba /🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas tshangs pa'i dbyangs su brjod de sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba gdab pa dang; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rab tu dga' bar bya ba byed cing sems can gyi don tshad med
analyzed: dpral ba nas tshangs pa chen po spyod lam rab tu zhi ba / sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas tshangs pa'i dbyangs su brjod de sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba gdab pa dang; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rab tu dga' bar bya ba byed cing sems can gyi don tshad med
translated: He saw great Brahmās coming from their foreheads, with peaceful conduct,🔽as numerous as the atoms in countless buddha realms, speaking with the voice of Brahmā, supplicating all the buddhas and delighting all the bodhisattvas, and filling the whole realm of phenomena in the ten directions with the effort to benefit beings.

original: pa la brtson par phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: pa la brtson par phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo //
translated: The merchant’s son Sudhana saw them.

original: mgo nas byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas /
analyzed: mgo nas byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas /
translated: From the crown of his head came forth bodhisattvas as numerous as the atoms in countless buddha-fields.

original: kha dog dang dbyings sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i lus yongs su ston cing /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyings sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i lus yongs su ston cing /
translated: They revealed bodies adorned with various colors and forms,

original: dpe byad bzang pos rnam par bris pa'i lus rab tu bstan pa dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu dgye ba dang / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang pos rnam par bris pa'i lus rab tu bstan pa dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu dgye ba dang / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nas bzung ste /
translated: they revealed bodies inscribed with the major marks of a great being, they emitted clouds of halos without end or middle, and from all their pores they emitted clouds of the forms of all the buddhas, beginning with their first development of the aspiration for enlightenment,

original: gtong ba dang / len pa dang / dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i rnam pa'i sprin @140a *//
analyzed: gtong ba dang / len pa dang / dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i rnam pa'i sprin @140a *//
translated: their practice of the bodhisattva conduct, their giving, their taking, and the forms of their giving things away.

original: mang po rab tu dgye ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi spyor ba rgya mtsho yongs su bstan pa dang / sbyin pa'i spyod pa 'jig rten du yongs su brjod pa dang / ser sna'i dri ma rnam par bzlog pa dang /
analyzed: mang po rab tu dgye ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi spyor ba rgya mtsho yongs su bstan pa dang / sbyin pa'i spyod pa 'jig rten du yongs su brjod pa dang / ser sna'i dri ma rnam par bzlog pa dang /
translated: the vast ocean of his previous conduct endowed with the various perfections; the proclamation of the practice of generosity in the world; the removal of the stains of miserliness;

original: chags pa thams cad spang ba la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / 'jig rten rin po che sna tshogs thams cad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan par byin gyis brlab pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang /
analyzed: chags pa thams cad spang ba la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / 'jig rten rin po che sna tshogs thams cad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan par byin gyis brlab pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang /
translated: the establishment of beings in the abandonment of all attachments; the blessing of adorning the world with all kinds of precious ornaments; the establishment of beings in the perfection of generosity;

original: mtshan thams cad kyi yon tan yang dag par brjod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mtshan 'byung ba'i rgyu ston pa byed pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: mtshan thams cad kyi yon tan yang dag par brjod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mtshan 'byung ba'i rgyu ston pa byed pa mthong ngo //
translated: and the teaching of the causes for the arising of the Buddha’s marks.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas /
translated: Then, bodhisattvas as numerous as the atoms in countless buddha realms emerged from the ground and said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra, “Noble one, we have not heard the name of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing /
translated: He was teaching the perfection of morality.🔽He was teaching the ocean of past deeds associated with the perfection of morality of all buddhas in all his pores.

original: ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba rgya mtsho yongs su bstan pa dang / sems can thams cad lam gyi rgyud dang yul las phyir phyogs par byas te /
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba rgya mtsho yongs su bstan pa dang / sems can thams cad lam gyi rgyud dang yul las phyir phyogs par byas te /
translated: He was turning beings away from the realms of the paths and the realms of objects,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la mngon du phyogs par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa la rnam par smad pa dang / 'jig rten gyi phyin ci log gi ling tog rnam par bsal ba dang / log pa'i rnam par rtog pa rab tu zhi bar @140b byas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la mngon du phyogs par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa la rnam par smad pa dang / 'jig rten gyi phyin ci log gi ling tog rnam par bsal ba dang / log pa'i rnam par rtog pa rab tu zhi bar @140b byas nas /
translated: and he was turning them toward the realm of the tathāgatas. He was condemning the desires of the world. He was removing the cataracts of the world’s wrong views. He was pacifying wrong thoughts.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la yang dag par dgod pa dang / snying rje chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su brjod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la yang dag par dgod pa dang / snying rje chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su brjod cing /
translated: He was establishing beings in the morality of the bodhisattvas. He was teaching the morality of great compassion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to attain the morality of the tathagatas,🔽they were establishing beings in the morality of the practice of the path of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam nan tan du bya ba'i tshul khrims la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud rmi lam lta bur sems can rnams la rab tu brjod cing; rmi lam gyi tshul dang mnyam par yongs su gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam nan tan du bya ba'i tshul khrims la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud rmi lam lta bur sems can rnams la rab tu brjod cing; rmi lam gyi tshul dang mnyam par yongs su gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and they were teaching beings about the dreamlike nature of the continuum of existence, in order to bring them to the state of being like a dream.

original: yul yongs su 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa la dbang bsgyur ba sems can rnams rab tu dgod pa byed pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: yul yongs su 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa la dbang bsgyur ba sems can rnams rab tu dgod pa byed pa mthong ngo //
translated: They were establishing beings in the mastery of the objects and the mastery of the afflictions.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas /
translated: Then bodhisattvas as numerous as the atoms in countless buddha realms came from the ten directions,

original: 'jig rten rnams la mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bur mngon par ston cing; khro ba med pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / shar gnyer ba med pa dang / zhe sdang ba med pa dang / chud gson pa med pa dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang /🔽byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad yongs su gcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams la mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bur mngon par ston cing; khro ba med pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / shar gnyer ba med pa dang / zhe sdang ba med pa dang / chud gson pa med pa dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad yongs su gcad pa'i phyir /
translated: They manifest to worldly beings in the color of gold,🔽and they establish beings in a state of mind that is without anger, without disturbance, without contention, without hatred, without loss, and without hostility.🔽In order to cut through all the paths of the animal realm,🔽

original: ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba'i srid rab tu 'gyed cing /🔽bzod pa'i stobs la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / chos la dbang bsgyur ba la sems can rab tu snang bar byed @141a *//
analyzed: ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba'i srid rab tu 'gyed cing / bzod pa'i stobs la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / chos la dbang bsgyur ba la sems can rab tu snang bar byed @141a *//
translated: They saw that all the pores of his body were emanating the perfection of patience, which was endowed with the past aspirations of the tathāgatas, in order to cut through all the paths of the animal realms.

original: pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: pa mthong ngo //
translated: They saw that he was establishing beings in the power of patience and in the mastery of the Dharma.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste /
translated: Also, bodhisattvas as numerous as the atoms in countless buddha-fields came forth,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi stobs mtha' yas pa shin tu ston cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi stobs mtha' yas pa shin tu ston cing /
translated: and they revealed the infinite strength of the bodhisattvas’ diligence.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du brtsams pa las phyir mi ldog pa'i stobs kyis thos pa rgya mtsho yongs su btsal bas mi skyo bar bya bar yongs su brjod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod cing rim gro bya ba la sems can rab tu gzud pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du brtsams pa las phyir mi ldog pa'i stobs kyis thos pa rgya mtsho yongs su btsal bas mi skyo bar bya bar yongs su brjod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod cing rim gro bya ba la sems can rab tu gzud pa /
translated: They spoke of the indefatigability of seeking the ocean of learning with the strength of irreversibility in the undertaking of omniscience,🔽and they established beings in the great diligence that averts all the aggregates of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i brtson 'grus chen po la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba mang po'i sprin lus thams cad las rab tu 'gyed cing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i brtson 'grus chen po la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba mang po'i sprin lus thams cad las rab tu 'gyed cing /
translated: And they emanated from their bodies clouds of many past deeds associated with the perfection of diligence.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su bstan pa dang / sems can rnams kyi le lo'i ri rnam par gtor ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su bstan pa dang / sems can rnams kyi le lo'i ri rnam par gtor ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang /
translated: He saw him teaching the practice of the perfection of diligence of the bodhisattvas, destroying the mountain of laziness of beings, and establishing beings in the perfection of diligence.

original: las la dbang bsgyur ba la 'jig rten rab tu gzud pa dang / rgyun ma 'chad par brtson par byed pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: las la dbang bsgyur ba la 'jig rten rab tu gzud pa dang / rgyun ma 'chad par brtson par byed pa mthong ngo //
translated: He saw him guiding the world to the mastery of karma and to uninterrupted diligence.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rjes su dran pa'i lam la @141b sems can thams cad rab tu dgod cing /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rjes su dran pa'i lam la @141b sems can thams cad rab tu dgod cing /
translated: Then, bodhisattvas as numerous as the atoms in countless buddha realms emerged from the ground and established all beings in the path of the bodhisattvas’ recollection.

original: sgrib pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang / rab rib thams cad rnam par bsal ba dang / rlom pa dang bag med pa thams cad las sems can rnam par bzlog pa dang / bag yod pa'i chos la rab tu dgod pa dang / khengs pa 'gying ba dang /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang / rab rib thams cad rnam par bsal ba dang / rlom pa dang bag med pa thams cad las sems can rnam par bzlog pa dang / bag yod pa'i chos la rab tu dgod pa dang / khengs pa 'gying ba dang /
translated: He saw him dispelling all obscurations, hindrances, and cataracts, turning beings away from all pride and carelessness, establishing them in the Dharma of carefulness, and lowering the banner of pride, haughtiness, and arrogance.

original: nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan rab tu snyol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan gyi yan lag rgya mtsho brjod pa dang / 'jig rten rnams la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsngags pa dang / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi tshul mang po'i sprin rab tu dgye ba dang /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan rab tu snyol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan gyi yan lag rgya mtsho brjod pa dang / 'jig rten rnams la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsngags pa dang / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi tshul mang po'i sprin rab tu dgye ba dang /
translated: He saw him describing the ocean of the branches of the buddhas’ dhyāna, praising the perfection of dhyāna to the world, and emanating from all his pores clouds of many past accounts related to the perfection of dhyāna.

original: sems can la dbang bsgyur ba la sems can rab tu dgod pa byed cing /
analyzed: sems can la dbang bsgyur ba la sems can rab tu dgod pa byed cing /
translated: He saw him establishing beings in the mastery of the mind.

original: skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa mthong ngo //
translated: He saw him filling the realm of phenomena in every instant.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste /

translated: He sent down a rain of Dharma from the cloud called the treasury of joy, he sent down a rain of Dharma from the cloud called the inexhaustible treasury of the basis for the beings who experience form, and he sent down a rain of Dharma from the cloud called the melody of the ocean of conduct that is beyond measure to the devas of the class of Brahmā.

original: dbang sgyur gyi lha rnams la stobs 'byung ba'i chos kyi yo byad mi zad pa'i mdzod ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs rgyal mtshan sna tshogs can yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang /

analyzed: mtshe ma'i lha rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su dran pa'i mdzod ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi gnas su de @145b bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas dga' ba'i shugs 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang /
translated: He caused a rain from the cloud of the Dharma called the treasury of the recollection of all the tathagatas to fall on the devas of the Thirty-Three;🔽he caused a rain from the cloud of the Dharma called the arising of the power of joy through seeing the tathagata to fall on the abode of the deva lord of the Thirty-Three;

original: gnod sbyin gyi dbang po'i gnas su chos kyi dbyings kyi nam mkha' la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas rnam par 'phrul pas rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / dri za'i dbang po'i gnas su de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos yang dag par bgro ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang /

translated: he caused a rain from the cloud of the Dharma called the pervading of the sky of the realm of phenomena with the emanations of the tathagatas to fall on the abode of the lord of the yakshas; he caused a rain from the cloud of the Dharma called the recitation of the Dharma of all the tathagatas to fall on the abode of the lord of the gandharvas;

original: lha ma yin gyi gnas su ye shes kyi tshul rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / nam mkha' lding gi dbang po'i gnas su de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i thabs kyi sprin ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang /

translated: in the realm of the demigods, a Dharma rain called the cloud of the vajra maṇḍala of the way of pristine consciousness;🔽in the realm of the garuḍa lords, a Dharma rain called the cloud of the method of the arising of all tathāgatas;🔽in the realm of the kinnara lords, a Dharma rain called the cloud of the voice of all beings entering the Dharma;

original: mi'am ci'i dbang po'i gnas su chos kyi sprin yang dag par 'gro ba thams cad kyi dbyangs zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / klu'i dbang po'i gnas su byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul ba sgrog cing srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud las skyo ba skyed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang /

original: lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po'i gnas su dga' ba rgya mtsho rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i shugs zhes bya ba'i chos kyi @146a *//

original: sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / mi'i gnas su 'gro ba thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'jig rten du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi ba'i dbyangs dang /
analyzed: sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / mi'i gnas su 'gro ba thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'jig rten du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi ba'i dbyangs dang /

translated: in the animal realm, a rain of Dharma clouds called “the melody of the practice of the path of action that is without misdeeds”;

translated: He was causing a rain of Dharma clouds to fall called the clouds of the essence of the maṇḍala of the recollection of the tathāgatas,🔽and in the world of Yama he was causing a rain of Dharma clouds to fall called the arising of the mind of generosity of all beings through the proclamation of the perfections of all the tathāgatas,

original: sems can thams cad kyi gtong ba'i sems 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / sems can log par lhung ba rnams la sdug bsngal thams cad zhi ba rab tu 'thob pas dbugs dbyung ba'i dbyangs kyi nga ro zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa mdzad cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gtong ba'i sems 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / sems can log par lhung ba rnams la sdug bsngal thams cad zhi ba rab tu 'thob pas dbugs dbyung ba'i dbyangs kyi nga ro zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa mdzad cing /

translated: He saw the maṇḍala of the conduct, observances, and vows of all the bodhisattvas of the three times.🔽In some of the nets of light rays and maṇḍalas that emerged from his pores, he saw the bodhisattvas of the past.🔽

analyzed: nyams su bzod pa byed pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa mthong @147a *//

analyzed: ngo; ;byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du byung ba /

translated: who had bodies that were imagined, who had endured, endured, and endured again all the harm to their bodies and minds and all the cutting off of their major and minor body parts in order to seek the Dharma of omniscience, who had endured it all through being guided by great compassion,🔽and who had endured it through being patient, through being forbearing, and through being indifferent.

analyzed: ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor la la las ni /

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yul der bas sam ma bas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yul der bas sam ma bas /
translated: Is the domain of this samādhi vast or not?”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: He said, “Son of noble family!

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di la snyoms par zhugs pa la ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dmigs pa la thogs pa med do //🔽'jig rten gyi khams su 'jug par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di la snyoms par zhugs pa la ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dmigs pa la thogs pa med do // 'jig rten gyi khams su 'jug par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: For one who has entered this samādhi, there is no impediment to the perception of world systems.🔽There is no impediment to entering world systems.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par gnon pa la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par gnon pa la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no impediment to conquering world systems.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su brgyan pa la thogs pa med do //🔽'jig rten gyi khams yongs su sbyang ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su brgyan pa la thogs pa med do // 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su sbyang ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no obstruction to the adornment of the world.🔽There is no obstruction to the purification of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no obstruction to the purification of the world.

original: sangs rgyas blta zhing rnam par dmigs par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas blta zhing rnam par dmigs par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no obstruction to seeing and observing the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che ba brtag pa la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che ba brtag pa la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no obstruction to the investigation of the greatness of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su shes par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su shes par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no obstruction to the knowledge of the miracles of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi stobs la 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi stobs la 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no obstruction to the understanding and comprehension of the power of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya mtshor 'jug pa la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya mtshor 'jug pa la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no obstruction to entering the ocean of the qualities of the buddhas.

original: sangs @151a *// rgyas kyi chos kyi sprin gyi char yongs su gzung ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs @151a *// rgyas kyi chos kyi sprin gyi char yongs su gzung ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no obstruction to receiving the rain of the Dharma clouds of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo 'khor ma 'dres pa shes shing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo 'khor ma 'dres pa shes shing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no impediment to knowing and penetrating the distinct turning of the wheel of the Dharma of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgya mtsho la 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgya mtsho la 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no impediment to entering into and penetrating the ocean of the assemblies of the retinue of the Buddhas.

original: phyogs bcur 'jug cing rjes su bgrang bar bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: phyogs bcur 'jug cing rjes su bgrang bar bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no impediment to entering into and following the ten directions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa rjes su brtag par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa rjes su brtag par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no impediment to following the teaching of the Dharma of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi phyogs rjes su brtag par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phyogs rjes su brtag par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no impediment to following the side of the Buddhas.

original: snying rje chen po'i phyogs rnam par mi spang pa la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i phyogs rnam par mi spang pa la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no impediment to not abandoning the side of great compassion.

original: byams pas phyogs rgyas par dgang ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: byams pas phyogs rgyas par dgang ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no impediment to filling the side with love.

original: sangs rgyas blta ba'i phyogs la 'jug pas mi ngoms par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas blta ba'i phyogs la 'jug pas mi ngoms par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: There is no impediment to being insatiable in entering into the side of seeing the Buddhas.

original: sems can rgya mtsho thams cad du 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do; ;sems can gyi dbang po rgya mtsho thams cad shes shing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sems can rgya mtsho thams cad du 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do; ;sems can gyi dbang po rgya mtsho thams cad shes shing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: I am unimpeded in entering and comprehending the ocean of all beings.

original: sems can gyi dbang po thams cad shes par bya ba la thogs pa med do //🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: sems can gyi dbang po thams cad shes par bya ba la thogs pa med do // rigs kyi bu /
translated: I am unimpeded in knowing and comprehending the ocean of the faculties of all beings.

original: kho bos ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa 'di shes su zad na /
analyzed: kho bos ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa 'di shes su zad na /
translated: “Noble one, I know only this Dharma of the bodhisattvas, which is the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la @151b rnam par spyod pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la @151b rnam par spyod pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa /
translated: How could I know the conduct or describe the qualities of the bodhisattvas who have entered the ocean of the practice of the perfection of wisdom?

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi yul la blo gros rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi yul la blo gros rnam par dag pa /
translated: They have a pure mind that is the domain of the realm of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad la rig pa rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes can /
analyzed: chos thams cad la rig pa rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes can /
translated: They have the wisdom that follows all phenomena.

original: blo shin tu yangs pas tshad med pa'i yul rgyas par 'gengs pa /
analyzed: blo shin tu yangs pas tshad med pa'i yul rgyas par 'gengs pa /
translated: They have an immeasurable domain that is filled with a vast mind.

original: gzungs chen po'i snang ba la dbang bsgyur ba /
analyzed: gzungs chen po'i snang ba la dbang bsgyur ba /
translated: They have the power of the light of the great dhāraṇīs.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor snang ba thams cad shin tu dag pa mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu 'byin pa la shin tu 'byung ba /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor snang ba thams cad shin tu dag pa mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu 'byin pa la shin tu 'byung ba /
translated: The maṇḍala of samādhi is the manifestation of the pure superknowledges.

original: tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mi zad pa'i rgya mtsho la zhugs pa /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mi zad pa'i rgya mtsho la zhugs pa /
translated: The power of the bull is the arising of the different perfect knowledges.
